author: Staff Reporter
text:
Along with VCK cadre, they stage protest at GH

Relatives of a 75-year-old man, who was found dead in his house following a clash between two communities, staged a protest at the Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital here on Tuesday.

The relatives, along with the members of Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi, said that they suspected foul play in the death and demanded the police to register a murder case.

On Monday, clash erupted between youth of two communities at Ambedkar Colony in Mettupatti outside the house of the victim, Ramu. Later, Ramu was found dead at his residence.

His relatives alleged that he was beaten to death. They blocked the Ayothiapattanam – Harur Main Road in the same night.

Police pacified them and the body was taken to the hospital.

Karipatti police registered a case under Sections, 147(unlawful assembly), 148 (unlawful assembly with deadly weapons), 324 (causing grievous hurt), 506 (ii)(criminal intimidation) of IPC and Section 3 (1) (x) of SC/ST Act and 174 of CrPC (death under unnatural circumstances).

On Tuesday, relatives demanded that the Sections be altered invoking the IPC provisions for murder and demanded the arrest of culprits. Along with VCK cadre, they staged a protest on the hospital premises.

Later, the police pacified them and assured that based on the post-mortem reports, the sections would be altered.
title: Relatives suspect foul play in elderly man’s death
